questions.question_text:
Your database is in NOARCHIVELOG mode. You want to enable archiving for the database.
Examine the steps:
1. Execute the ALTER DATABASE ARCHIVELOG command.
2. Execute SHUTDOWN IMMEDIATE.
3. Execute STARTUP MOUNT.
4. Set the DB_RECOVERY_FILE_DEST parameter to $ORACLE_HOME/dbs/.
5. Execute STARTUP NOMOUNT.
6. Open the database.
Identify the required steps in the correct sequence.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A clean shutdown is required and transfer to archivelog-mode is done in mount-mode/stage.

Selected Answer: D
When a DBaaS database instance is created, network access to the instance is limited to Secure Shell (SSH) connections on port 22. This access restriction ensures that the instance is secure by default. You can either ask your cloud service administrator to open ports or, as you will learn in this tutorial, you can use SSH client software to create an SSH tunnel to connect securely to the database and its tools. Several SSH clients are freely available, including the SSH utility on Linux platforms and the PuTTY utility on Windows platforms.

questions.question_text: Identify the access that is initially available to connect to your Database as a Service (DBaaS) environment.

discussion.content:
I agree D
Enable resource limits dynamically with the ALTER SYSTEM statement or with the initialization parameter RESOURCE_LIMIT. This parameter does not apply to password resources. Password resources are always enabled.

Correct

"Enable resource limits dynamically with the ALTER SYSTEM statement or with the initialization parameter RESOURCE_LIMIT. This parameter does not apply to password resources. Password resources are always enabled."

https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/SQLRF/statements_6012.htm#SQLRF01310

choices.A: Resource limits specified in a profile assigned to a user are always enabled.
choices.C: A profile can be assigned only to one user.
choices.D: Password management using profiles is always enabled.
choices.B: A user can exist without any profile.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about profiles?
Which task is performed by a background process in a database instance?

choices.A: Connecting between a client process and a dispatcher
choices.D: Copying online redo log files to offline storage

discussion.content: I agree D, It is el ARCn

Selected Answer: A
Correct because the instance was started using pfile.

questions.question_text:
Examine the parameters:
Your database instance is started with a PFILE.
//IMG//

You want to increase the size of the buffer cache. Free memory is available to increase the size of the buffer cache.
You execute the command:
SQL> ALTER SYSTEM SET DB_CACHE_SIZE=1024M;
Which is the outcome?

choices.D: It fails because the SCOPE clause is missing.
choices.B: The value is changed only in the PFILE and takes effect at the next instance startup.
choices.C: The value is changed for the current instance and in the PFILE.
choices.A: Change is applied to the current instance, but does not persist after instance restart.
